articles.author: Eric Garcia
articles.description:
Communication with the video detection ‚öôÔ∏è


For communicating the change in variables modified in the detection algorithm, a AppSignals class is created, taking advantage of the pyqtSignal facility.
class AppSignals(QObject):
    stop_detection = pyqtSignal()
    start_detection = pyqtSignal()
    update_reps = pyqtSignal(int)
    update_avg_time = pyqtSignal(float)
    update_training_time = pyqtSignal(int)
    update_set_time = pyqtSignal(int)
    update_rest_time = pyqtSignal(int)

This class is used in the initializer method of the Home class
class Home(QWidget):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.initUI()
        self.settings()

        self.app_signals = AppSignals()
        self.detection_worker = DetectionWorker(self.app_signals)

        self.start_se‚Ä¶

Welcome to our blog! Today, we're diving into the world of OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) with a focus on a powerful tool called PhoneInfoga. If you're curious about how to uncover detailed information from a phone number, you're in the right place.
PhoneInfoga is designed to help you gather various pieces of information about phone numbers using publicly available resources. Whether you're a cybersecurity enthusiast or just interested in learning more about OSINT, this tool is a great way to enhance your skills.
In this post, we'll walk you through the process of using PhoneInfoga, from installation to retrieving valuable information. This tool is particularly useful for identifying details like the carrier, country, and area of a phone number. Plus, its Python-based framework ensures c‚Ä¶

Hi devs üëã
I wanted to share my journey of building and launching a real, working web product entirely solo in 2025 ‚Äî including backend, frontend, deployment, and even a Chrome extension.
If you‚Äôve ever dreamed of creating your own product but felt overwhelmed, maybe this post will give you a push. AI has changed the game ‚Äî and what used to take a team can now be done by one developer.
I‚Äôve worked as a Java backend engineer for over a decade across industries like telecom, travel, music, and insurance. But I always had the itch to build something of my own ‚Äî even something small, as long as I could call it mine.
I actually tried once, eight years ago. It didn‚Äôt work out. I lacked motivation, frontend skills, and time. It felt like too much to handle alone.
Then came ChatGPT and similar too‚Ä¶

articles.author: Jordan Knightin
articles.description:
MongoDB remains a powerful tool in 2025, being one of the most popular NoSQL databases. Its flexibility and scalability make it a preferred choice for many developers and data scientists. While working with MongoDB, understanding query operators is crucial for efficient data retrieval and manipulation. This article explores some common MongoDB query operators used in 2025.
Query operators in MongoDB are special keywords used to specify conditions in queries. They allow for complex queries and data manipulation by providing a way to filter, sort, and modify documents within a collection.
$eq - Equals


The $eq operator is used to match documents where the value of a field equals the specified value. It is equivalent to the equality sign in many query languages.
Example:
db.collection.find({‚Ä¶
articles.title: What Are Some Common Mongodb Query Operators in 2025?

If you‚Äôre a developer‚Äîor just getting started with programming‚Äîyou may have heard people recommend Linux over Windows. But why is that the case? In this blog, we‚Äôll explore the key reasons **Linux is a top choice for developers, and we‚Äôll also explain some essential computer terms like **OS, **Processor, and **Core in simple language.
Linux is a developer's playground. It supports popular programming languages such as:

articles.author: Stephano Kambeta
articles.description:
Welcome to our comprehensive guide on utilizing Aircrack-Ng in Termux! Aircrack-Ng is a powerful suite of tools designed to enhance Wi-Fi network security by offering advanced monitoring and testing capabilities. Originally developed for Linux distributions, Aircrack-Ng has proven its versatility across various operating systems, including Windows. Its primary functions include monitoring Wi-Fi networks, exporting data to text files, and testing the functionality of Wi-Fi cards.
In this guide, we'll explore how to set up and use Aircrack-Ng within Termux, a unique terminal emulator for Android that provides a Linux-like environment on your mobile device. Whether you're a cybersecurity enthusiast or just curious about network security, this guide will help you get started with Aircrack-Ng o‚Ä¶
articles.title: Utilizing Aircrack-Ng in Termux: Comprehensive Guide for Wi-Fi Network Security

articles.description:
MongoDB, a powerful NoSQL database, is widely used due to its flexibility and scalability. One common operation when working with databases is counting documents that match a specific query. In this article, we'll explore various methods to count documents matching a query in MongoDB efficiently.
Counting documents in MongoDB is crucial for understanding data distribution, measuring performance, and generating reports or analytics. Accurately counting documents can also assist in decision-making processes within your applications.
MongoDB provides several methods to count documents that match a query:
count()


The count() method is a straightforward way to count documents in a collection that match a given query. Here‚Äôs how to use it:
db.collection.count({ <query> });

Example:
db.users.c‚Ä¶
articles.title: How to Count Documents That Match a Query in Mongodb?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
A group of developers within the Ethereum ecosystem, operating independently of the Ethereum Foundation, have announced Ethereum R1 ‚Äî a layer-2 (L2) scaling solution for the Ethereum network that does not include a native token.
According to the announcement, the project relies entirely on donations, does not have venture funding, and does not have any pre-mined token allocations or a governance token. The project's team wrote in a May 1 X post:
"General-purpose L2s should be commodities ‚Äî simple, replaceable, and free from centralized dependencies or risky governance. Ethereum R1 is our answer to that call ‚Äî the rollup grounded in credible neutrality, decentralization, and censorship resistance."
"Most L2s today are acting more like new L1s than an Ethereum scaling solution ‚Äî private allo‚Ä¶
articles.title: Devs introduce Ethereum R1 layer-2 scaling solution

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Andrew Singer
articles.description:
Love it or leave it, New York State has been a force in crypto regulation.
Ten years ago, the state created the United States‚Äô first comprehensive regulatory framework for firms dealing in cryptocurrencies, including key consumer protection, anti-money laundering compliance and cybersecurity guidelines.
In September 2015, the New York Department of Financial Services (NYDFS) issued its first BitLicense to Circle Internet Financial, enabling the company to conduct digital currency business activity in the state. Ripple Markets received the second BitLicense in 2016. Circle and Ripple went on to become giant players in the global cryptocurrency and stablecoin industry.
Today, the NYDFS regulates one of the largest pools of crypto firms in the world, and it is often cited as the gold standard‚Ä¶
articles.title: Federal crypto legislation could come with a ‚ÄòNew York State of Mind‚Äô

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vikash Singh
articles.description:
Opinion by: Vikash Singh, Principal Investor at Stillmark
The Bybit hack resulted in the largest loss of funds to cyber hackers by a cryptocurrency exchange in history. It served as a wake-up call for those complacent about the state of security threats in the digital assets space. Everyone must learn the lesson from this heist ‚Äî enterprise-grade custody solutions require tech to be accompanied by transparency.
Unlike many previous incidents, this loss of funds was not due to a faulty smart contract, lost/mismanaged keys or deliberate mismanagement or rehypothecation of user funds, but rather a sophisticated social engineering attack that exploited vulnerabilities in operational security.¬†
This hack differs from earlier eras because it happened to a major global exchange that takes securit‚Ä¶
articles.title: The case for enterprise-grade custody solutions

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Zoltan Vardai
articles.description:
Bitcoin‚Äôs expanding institutional adoption may provide the ‚Äústructural‚Äù inflows necessary to surpass gold‚Äôs market capitalization and push its price beyond $1 million by 2029, according to Bitwise‚Äôs head of European research, Andr√© Dragosch.
‚ÄúOur in-house prediction is $1 million by 2029. So that Bitcoin will match gold's market cap and total addressable market by 2029,‚Äù he told Cointelegraph during the Chain Reaction daily X spaces show on April 30.

Corporations are coming for your bitcoin (feat. Andr√© Dragosch, Head of Research at Bitwise) #CHAINREACTION https://t.co/5F3cRWBHzq

Gold is currently the world‚Äôs largest asset, valued at over $21.7 trillion. In comparison, Bitcoin‚Äôs market capitalization sits at $1.9 trillion, making it the sev‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin to $1M by 2029 fueled by ETF and gov‚Äôt demand ‚Äî Bitwise exec

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
The demand for yield-generating strategies around Bitcoin (BTC) is surging, especially from firms seeking liquidity without liquidating their BTC, according to Ryan Chow, co-founder and CEO of Solv Protocol.
During a fireside chat at the Token2049 conference in Dubai on May 1, Chow said institutional interest in Bitcoin yield products has grown exponentially over the past few years.
Initially, generating Bitcoin yield was nearly impossible. However, recent innovations like staking via proof-of-stake (PoS) protocols and delta-neutral trading strategies have made this possible.
Layer-1 and layer-2 advancements, such as Babylon, have made these strategies more viable. Babylon allows BTC holders to earn yield on their assets, which are used to provide security and liquidity for PoS networks.
‚Äú‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin yield demand booming as institutions seek liquidity ‚Äî Solv CEO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Ethereum developers are working to improve blockchain interoperability with two new token standards: ERC-7930 and ERC-7828.
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no standard way for wallets, apps, or protocols to interpret or display this information,‚Äù decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem development organization Wonderland wrote in a May 1 X post. Wallets, decentralized applications (DApps), block explorers and smart contracts follow different rules.
‚ÄúThe result? A messy, inconsistent experience that breaks cross-chain UX,‚Äú Wonderland stated.
Wonderland is a group of developers, researchers and data scientists focused on improving the Ethereum DeFi ecosystem. The organization partnered with multiple DeFi protocols, including Optimism, Aztec, Connext and Yearn.
Wonderland‚Äôs ERC-7828 and ERC-7930 explanation post. So‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ethereum to simplify crosschain transactions with new token standards

SOL/USD four chart. Source: Cointelegraph/TradingView

An increase in open long positions in the futures market preceded SOL‚Äôs rally above $150 today. 
SOL futures open interest climbed 5% over the last 30 days to 38.7 million SOL on May 1. In dollar terms, this represents $5.8‚Ä¶
articles.title: Why is Solana (SOL) price up today?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz
articles.description:
Major European cryptocurrency investment firm 21Shares has filed for a spot Sui exchange-traded fund (ETF) in the United States, marking another step in its expansion to the US market.
21Shares on April 30 submitted the Form S-1 registration for a spot Sui (SUI) ETF to the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
Called the 21Shares Sui ETF, the proposed ETF will issue common shares of beneficial interest by seeking to track the performance of SUI held by 21Shares‚Äô US subsidiary.
The US filing comes a year after 21Shares started trading the 21Shares Sui Staking exchange-traded product in Europe in July 2024, with its first listings on Euronext Paris and Euronext Amsterdam.
No ticker or planned exchange yet
The 128-page filing does not specify on which US exchange the new SUI ETF is exp‚Ä¶
articles.title: 21Shares files for US spot Sui ETF after European launch

Today in crypto, Morgan Stanley reportedly plans to enable cryptocurrency trading on its E*Trade platform by 2026, marking a deeper push into digital assets amid a shifting US regulatory landscape. The crypto-tied eye scanning project World is now in the US, and Ripple reportedly made a $5 billion bid to acquire Circle. 
Morgan Stanley eyes crypto rollout for E*Trade platform: Bloomberg
Banking giant Morgan Stanley reportedly plans to list cryptocurrencies on its E*Trade investment brokerage and trading platform.
According to a May 1 Bloomberg report, the firm intends to list crypto assets on E*Trade in 2026. The plan is still in early development, and the bank is said to be exploring partnerships with established crypto firms to power the service. Internal discussions about cryptocurrency‚Ä¶
articles.title: Here‚Äôs what happened in crypto today

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz and Sam Bourgi
articles.description:
Amid the intensifying global race to tokenize real-world assets, the market is still too nascent for institutional adoption, according to Chris Yin, the co-founder and CEO of Galaxy-backed RWA platform Plume.
Institutional capital is yet to enter the RWA market, and it will take some time for institutions to see its value, Yin told Cointelegraph on the sidelines of Token2049 in Dubai.
‚ÄúThese things move incredibly slowly, you have to show value, you have to show adoption first,‚Äù Yin said, comparing RWA‚Äôs currently developing stages with the early days of Bitcoin (BTC) and stablecoins.
‚ÄúOnly now, 10 years later, are they beginning to think about using the stablecoin. The same thing is going to happen in tokenized assets or tokenization,‚Äù Yin said.
Tokenized RWAs are far smaller than $21 bil‚Ä¶
articles.title: $21B tokenized RWA market doubtful, institutions uninterested ‚Äî  Plume CEO

articles.author: Cointelegraph by SK Arora
articles.description:
What is a Google subpoena scam?            
            
                
The Google subpoena scam is a type of phishing attack where fraudsters impersonate Google to create a false sense of urgency and fear.¬†
Typically, you will receive an email that appears to come from no-reply@google.com, claiming to inform you of a subpoena, a formal legal request. The email will often have a subject line like ‚ÄúSecurity Alert‚Äù or ‚ÄúNotice of Subpoena,‚Äù making it seem urgent and legitimate. These scammers prey on your natural concern about legal matters and data privacy, hoping to trigger a reaction.
Inside the email, the scammers falsely claim that Google has been served with a subpoena requiring the company to turn over your account data, such as emails, documents or search history. The email will the‚Ä¶
articles.title: Google subpoena scam: What it looks like and how to avoid it

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Banking giant Morgan Stanley reportedly plans to list cryptocurrencies on its E*Trade investment brokerage and trading platform.
According to a May 1 Bloomberg report, the firm intends to list crypto assets on E*Trade in 2026. The plan is still in early development, and the bank is said to be exploring partnerships with established crypto firms to power the service. Internal discussions about cryptocurrency support reportedly began in late 2024.
E*Trade homepage. Source: E*Trade
This would not be Morgan Stanley‚Äôs first exposure to digital assets. The bank‚Äôs wealthiest clients have had access to crypto exchange-traded funds (ETFs) and futures for some time, with the firm‚Äôs advisers allowed to pitch Bitcoin ETFs since August 2024.
Related: Morgan Stanley to explore crypto offerings for clien‚Ä¶
articles.title: Morgan Stanley eyes crypto rollout for E*Trade platform: Bloomberg

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
MultiBank Group, the world‚Äôs largest financial derivatives institution based in Dubai, has signed a landmark $3 billion real-world asset (RWA) tokenization agreement with United Arab Emirates (UAE)-based real estate giant MAG and blockchain infrastructure provider Mavryk.
The deal represents the largest RWA tokenization initiative globally to date and highlights the upcoming launch of MultiBank‚Äôs native utility token, MBG, according to a press release shared with Cointelegraph.
The partnership will bring MAG‚Äôs ultra-luxury real estate projects ‚Äî including The Ritz-Carlton Residences, Dubai, Creekside and the Keturah Reserve ‚Äî onto the blockchain via MultiBank.io‚Äôs regulated RWA marketplace.
Once tokenized, these assets will be available to global investors and will generate daily yield for‚Ä¶
articles.title: MultiBank, MAG, Mavryk ink world‚Äôs largest $3B RWA tokenization deal

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Zoltan Vardai
articles.description:
Abu Dhabi-based investment firm MGX will use a stablecoin linked to US President Donald Trump‚Äôs family to settle a $2 billion investment in Binance, the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchange.
The World Liberty Financial USD (USD1) US dollar-pegged stablecoin was launched by the Trump-associated crypto platform World Liberty Financial (WLFI) in March 2025.
MGX will use the USD1 stablecoin for its $2 billion investment in the Binance exchange, according to an announcement by Eric Trump during a panel discussion at Token2049 in Dubai. Trump, the son of the president, serves as executive vice president of the Trump Organization.
Source: Cointelegraph
MGX announced its investment in Binance on March 12, marking the first institutional investment in the exchange and one of the biggest funding ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Eric Trump: USD1 will be used for $2B MGX investment in Binance

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Crypto exchange MEXC has announced a $300 million ecosystem development fund aimed at supporting Web3 projects over the next five years.
The initiative, unveiled at Token2049 in Dubai, is designed to support early-stage blockchain technologies, public chains, wallets, and decentralized tools critical to shaping the future of crypto infrastructure, according to a press release shared with Cointelegraph.
Selection criteria for projects looking to participate in the initiative will be announced soon.
‚ÄúWe are committed to strategic investment, focusing not just on exciting ideas and talented developers, but on initiatives with clear long-term potential,‚Äù MEXC chief operating officer Tracy Jin said.
She added that the priority is to back projects capable of achieving AAA status within three to ‚Ä¶
articles.title: MEXC launches $300M Web3 fund, commits to ‚Äòstrategic investment‚Äô

Bitcoin traders wait for signals of US economic policy loosening as data forces the Federal Reserve into a corner.

Recession is more likely than not, sources say, amid rising unemployment and resurgent inflation.

Bitcoin and risk assets should ultimately gain from a recession shock.

Bitcoin (BTC) stands to gain as a US recession becomes the ‚Äúbase case scenario.‚Äù

The latest macroeconomic data, which includes Q1 GDP and the Fed‚Äôs ‚Äúpreferred‚Äù inflation gauge, puts officials in a tight s‚Ä¶

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amitej Gajjala
articles.description:
Opinion by: Amitej Gajjala, co-founder and CEO of Kernel DAO
The restaking narrative has moved fast ‚Äî from side conversations in validator circles to the forefront of DeFi infrastructure discussions.
It‚Äôs not hard to see why. DefiLlama states that major liquid restaking protocols now hold over $12 billion in total value locked (TVL), with dozens of middleware services aligning their security with Ethereum‚Äôs economic base layer. What started as an idea to increase capital efficiency for validators has evolved into a serious attempt to redefine how security is provisioned across decentralized systems.
While restaking is gaining momentum among crypto-native participants, institutions ‚Äî the kind with multi-year horizons and regulatory constraints ‚Äî still keep DeFi at arm‚Äôs length.
Not because ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Restaking can make DeFi more secure for institutional traders

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Metaplanet ‚Äî a Japanese company focused on accumulating Bitcoin ‚Äî announced it will launch a United States-based subsidiary.
In a May 1 X post, Metaplanet announced that the firm is launching a wholly owned subsidiary in Florida. Furthermore, the new subsidiary is expected to raise up to $250 million of capital to fuel its Bitcoin (BTC) accumulation strategy and tap US institutional investors.
In a separate announcement, Metaplanet cites Miami as the city that will host the new subsidiary‚Äôs headquarters. The firm points to Florida as a particularly favorable environment:
‚ÄúFlorida, a rapidly emerging hub for Bitcoin focused companies and financial innovation, recognized for its business-friendly policies and rising status as a global center of capital and technology.‚Äù
The company explained ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Metaplanet to open US arm, plans to raise $250M for Bitcoin strategy

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz
articles.description:
Decentralized stablecoin platform Ethena has partnered with The Open Network (TON) to make its stablecoins available to Telegram‚Äôs user base of over one billion people.
The partnership, announced on May 1 at Token2049 in Dubai, will see the deployment of Ethena‚Äôs USDe (USDE) and Ethena Staked USDe (sUSDe) natively within the TON blockchain.
The sUSDe variant will be integrated under the name tsUSDe, enabling Telegram users to access US dollar-denominated savings directly within Telegram.
Source: Kirill Malev
The deployment involves two major Ethena integrations, including one in the custodial Wallet in Telegram and the second in the TON Space wallet, a self-custodial wallet integrated in the messenger.
One of Ethena‚Äôs ‚Äúmost meaningful launches‚Äù
Announcing the news on X, Ethena described it‚Ä¶
articles.title: Ethena partners with TON to offer USDe to one billion Telegram users

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Sasha Shilina
articles.description:
Why do Ethereum upgrades matter?            
            
                
Ethereum upgrades are essential to scale, secure and evolve the network without compromising its decentralized foundation.
Ethereum still stands as the heavyweight of smart contract platforms, but staying on top means relentless reinvention. Every upgrade isn‚Äôt just a technical tweak; it‚Äôs a high-stakes move to crack the toughest problems in crypto: clogged scalability, soaring gas fees, clunky onboarding and the constant creep of centralization.
In a race where rivals are slashing transaction times and polishing user experiences, standing still isn‚Äôt an option. To hold its ground at the center of decentralized finance (DeFi), non-fungible tokens (NFTs) and Web3 as a whole, Ethereum must keep sharpening both its exe‚Ä¶
articles.title: Vitalik Buterin‚Äôs vision for Ethereum: Pectra, Glamsterdam and beyond

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Zoltan Vardai
articles.description:
Fragmentation and complicated user experience remain two of the most significant obstacles to cryptocurrency‚Äôs mainstream adoption, according to a new industry report. Most users now use at least two wallets to manage their cryptocurrency investments.
The¬†lack of interoperability¬†across blockchains means users need to create¬†multiple wallets¬†to interact with different networks, with users having at least two wallets rising by 16% over the past year. 
According to a research report published by onchain user experience platform Reown and crypto intelligence firm Nansen, 62% of crypto users reported using at least two wallets over the past three months, up from 45% in 2024.
More than 18% of respondents said security was their top concern related to wallet use, while 10.6% cited poor user expe‚Ä¶
articles.title: Multi-wallet usage up 16%, but AI may address crypto fragmentation gap

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Tesla CEO Elon Musk has lashed out at The Wall Street Journal (WSJ), calling the publication‚Äôs latest report ‚Äúan EXTREMELY BAD BREACH OF ETHICS,‚Äù after it claimed the Tesla board was actively seeking his replacement as CEO.
The report, published on April 30, alleged that the board had approached recruitment firms due to concerns over Musk‚Äôs political activity and split focus across multiple ventures.
Musk took to X to denounce the article, stating that the WSJ deliberately published false information while knowingly excluding an ‚Äúunequivocal denial‚Äù from Tesla‚Äôs board.
Tesla board chair Robyn Denholm also issued a strong rebuttal early Thursday morning, posting on Tesla‚Äôs official X account that the board had not contacted recruiters.
‚ÄúThis is absolutely false,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThe CEO of Tesla‚Ä¶
articles.title: ‚ÄòBad breach of ethics‚Äô ‚Äî Musk echoes crypto execs in backlash against WSJ

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ciaran Lyons
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Strategy‚Äôs stock rose 32% in April, its biggest monthly gain since November.

Speculation is building that Strategy will announce a major capital raise during its Q1 earnings call on May 1 as it continues to grow its Bitcoin holdings.

Analysts expect a 1% year-on-year revenue bump to $116.6 million, following the firm‚Äôs $120.7 million revenues for Q4 2024.

Michael Saylor‚Äôs Strategy closed April with its highest monthly gain since November, ahead of the firm‚Äôs highly anticipated earnings call on May 1.
Strategy (MSTR), formerly known as MicroStrategy, closed April 30 trading at $380.11, a 32% increase from its closing price of $288 on March 31, according to Google Finance data.
Speculation mounts on ‚Äúhuge capital raise‚Äù¬†
It‚Äôs Strategy's highest monthly gain in five months,‚Ä¶
articles.title: Strategy ends April up 32% in best month since November as Q1 earnings loom

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman‚Äôs crypto-tied digital identity project World, formerly Worldcoin, has made its US debut in six cities.¬†
The project, which aims to verify humans in the age of artificial intelligence, is initially coming to what it calls the ‚Äúkey innovation hubs‚Äù of Atlanta, Austin, Los Angeles, Miami, Nashville and San Francisco, according to an April 30 announcement.
World offers a crypto token, Worldcoin (WLD), to those who verify their identity with its spherical device called an Orb, which scans a user‚Äôs face and eyes. 
The firm had previously skirted launching in the US due to regulatory concerns over offering a token, fears now seemingly allayed with the crypto-friendly Trump administration.
The data from World‚Äôs Orb scan can be used to make a World ID on the company‚Äôs platform‚Ä¶
articles.title: Sam Altman‚Äôs eye-scanning crypto project World launches in US

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Crypto losses spiked by 1,163% over April, with the lion‚Äôs share of lost crypto coming from a single heist of an elderly US individual‚Äôs wallet, says blockchain security firm CertiK.
CertiK said in an April 30 X post that a total of $364 million was lost to exploits, hacks and scams in April, jumping from the $28.8 million recorded by CertiK in March.¬†
The firm added that white hat exploiters had returned around $18.2 million from exploits on the crypto protocols KiloEx, Loopscale and ZKsync, which brought down the month‚Äôs total.
The largest hack in April, and the fifth largest to date, involved an elderly US individual who lost 3,520 Bitcoin (BTC), valued at $330.7 million. The Bitcoin was stolen from their wallet after a hacker used advanced social engineering tactics to gain access on A‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto losses spike 1,100% in April with 5th-largest-ever hack: CertiK

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
The first decentralized finance (DeFi) company to launch a user-friendly suite of products on Bitcoin will ‚Äúwin the entire market‚Äù of the blockchain‚Äôs 300 million users, one crypto founder says.
Alexei Zamyatin, the co-founder of the Bitcoin layer 2 Build on Bitcoin, told Cointelegraph at Token2049 in Dubai that ‚Äúthe advantage of Bitcoin DeFi is that the market is much bigger, you have a much bigger retail user base that you can tap into.‚Äù
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not easy to convert it, but if you manage to win in Bitcoin DeFi, you win the entire market.‚Äù
Zamyatin said the 300 million Bitcoin users would mean DeFi services on the blockchain would ‚Äúoutgrow everything we've seen so far in Ethereum and Solana.‚Äù¬†
Build on Bitcoin is one of the firms looking to win market share, offering a hybrid layer 2 solutio‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin DeFi will have 300M users, beating Ethereum and Solana: Exec

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
North Carolina‚Äôs House of Representatives has passed a bill allowing the state‚Äôs treasurer to invest public funds in approved cryptocurrencies, which will now head to the Senate.
The House passed the Digital Assets Investment Act, or House Bill 92, on its third reading on April 30 by a vote of 71 to 44.
Republican House Speaker Destin Hall introduced the bill in February, which would allow the treasurer to allocate 5% of the state‚Äôs investments into designated digital assets.
The investments can only be made after obtaining an independent third-party assessment confirming that the crypto holdings are maintained with a secure custody solution and risk oversight and regulatory compliance standards are met.¬†
New amendments allow the treasurer to examine the feasibility of allowing members of ‚Ä¶
articles.title: North Carolina House passes state crypto investment bill

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ciaran Lyons
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Galaxy Digital plans to begin trading on the Nasdaq on May 16, pending shareholder and Nasdaq approval.

Nasdaq-listed crypto firms posted strong gains in April after a period of macroeconomic uncertainty.

Galaxy CEO Mike Novogratz says the listing will broaden the company‚Äôs investor base and US presence.

The Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX) listed crypto investment firm Galaxy Digital is set to move to the US-based Nasdaq on May 16, pending stakeholder approval at its upcoming shareholders meeting.
Galaxy‚Äôs planned move comes as several Nasdaq-listed crypto firms saw substantial gains in April, following a turbulent few months of macroeconomic uncertainty.
Galaxy founder and CEO Mike Novogratz said on April 30 that the listing would be a milestone ‚Äúthat would position us to ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Galaxy Digital plans Nasdaq listing as crypto stocks post strong rebound

articles.author: George Tebrean
articles.description:
November 2024 - April 2025
This report summarizes the activities and accomplishments of Web3j, an LF Decentralized Trust project, from November 2024 to April 2025. During this period, the project made significant strides in improving the framework‚Äôs functionality, enhancing user engagement, and bolstering overall community interaction.¬†

articles.title: Web3j Six Month Project Update
